Description:en: The full name of the patient undergoing cataract surgery
address of the patient
The gender of the patient, categorized as Male or Female.
A unique identifier assigned to the patient by the hospital.
The patient's age, recorded in years.
The visual acuity measurement for both the right and left eyes using the Snellen chart at 6 meters.
The initial visual acuity of the patient before any intervention.
The best-corrected visual acuity or pinhole visual acuity.
The condition of the lens, indicating whether it is clear or has opacities, and the readiness for surgery
Answers: Clear, Lens Examination ; Opacities, Lens Examination

Description:en: Any additional eye conditions that might affect the surgical outcome, such as corneal scars, old iritis, retinal disease, or glaucoma.
Answers: Corneal scars, Other Ocular Pathologies ; Retinal disease, Other Ocular Pathologies ; Glaucoma, Other Ocular Pathologies ; Other, Other Ocular Pathologies

Description:en: The eye designated for surgery, either the right or left.
Information about the targeted post-operative spherical equivalent and the axis of astigmatism.
Measurements of the eye, including K1, K2 (corneal curvature), and axial length, used to calculate the intraocular lens (IOL) power.
The date on which the cataract surgery is performed
The identification number of the hospital or camp where the surgery takes place.
The unique identifier for the surgeon performing the operation.
The location of the surgery, such as a base hospital, other hospital, or out-of-hospital setting.

The method used for cataract extraction, such as ICCE (Intracapsular Cataract Extraction), ECCE (Extracapsular Cataract Extraction), SICS (Small Incision Cataract Surgery), or Phacoemulsification (Phaco)
Answers: Intracapsular cataract extraction ; Extracapsular cataract extraction ; Small incision cataract surgery ; Phamacoemulsification

Description:en: The type of lens implanted, if any, such as PC IOL (Posterior Chamber Intraocular Lens), ACIOL (Anterior Chamber Intraocular Lens), or no IOL.
Answers: Posterior chamber intraocular lens ; Anterior Chamber Intraocular lens ; No IOL

Description:en: Any complications encountered during surgery, such as capsule rupture, vitreous loss, zonular dehiscence, or wound leak.
Answers: Capsule rupture ; Vitreous loss ; Zonular dehiscence ; Wound leak ; Other non-coded

Description:en: The visual acuity of the operated eye at various follow-up visits, measured both as presenting and best-corrected VA.

Fully specified name:en: Cause of Presenting Vision less than 6/80
Short name:en: Cause of Presenting Vision less than 6/80
Description:en: The reasons for suboptimal vision post-surgery if the visual acuity is less than 6/80.
Information about the patient's refractive status after the operation, if available.
